title: Energy and pd - electron in E field 1200 x-squared

content.question: An electric field in a region of space is described by the equation <math alttext="vector E equals A times x squared times i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="A equals 1200 newtons per coulomb meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1200</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo>/</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>C</mtext><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math>. If an electron moves in the negative <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-direction from <math alttext="x equals 0.20 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> to <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the change in electric potential energy of the electron-field system?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
